intro: Heuchera parviflora var. typica, commonly known as the silver queen heuchera, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features striking, silver-white to bluish-green foliage that adds visual interest to garden landscapes. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, or white during the summer months. It thrives in partial to full shade and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for borders, rock gardens, or as a ground cover.
